description: Rate, time, and distance problem with unit conversion
question: Two cars are traveling to the same destination 392 miles away. Car A travels at an average speed of 50 mph, while Car B travels at 62 mph. How much longer does the slower car take to reach the destination? Express your answer in hours and minutes.
ground_truth:
The slower car takes 1 hours and 31 minutes longer.

Solution:
Time for Car A = 392 ÷ 50 = 7.84 hours
Time for Car B = 392 ÷ 62 = 6.32 hours
Time difference = 1.52 hours = 1 hours and 31 minutes
